body.p: You can use the Palette enables to interact with the DRD and DRG:

ul.li: Add a new node to the DRD.
Create artifact nodes to the DRD, improving documentation, organization, and visualization.

body.p: To add a new DRG node you drag the desired node from the palette and drop it into the diagram.

fig.title: Dragging a new Input Data node from the Palette

image.alt: new editor diagram drag from palette

body.p: Using the artifact nodes you have the tools to improve the documentation and visualization of the DRG by modifying the DRD. The Group node creates a visual separation, and the Text Annotation enables to writing short documentation.

Clicking on it will open a modal providing access to the list of all DRG nodes that are part of the current file. It’s possible to filter the nodes by name, and nodes that are part of the current DRD are grayish. Clicking and dragging the node name to the diagram will add the node to the current DRD. More about this can be found in the DRD section.

image.alt: new editor diagram palette all drg nodes

body.p: All nodes that are part of the included models can be found here.
body.note: See the Included models section to learn more about Included models.
body.p: Clicking on it will open a dialog that shows all nodes separated by namespace. You can filter the nodes by name.

image.alt: new editor diagram palette external nodes

body.p: You can also see the chosen name for the included model and the DMN file name it originates from. In the above example the name is “ex” and the filename “Another DMN.dmn”.
